name: Phong Nguyen
content: Phong Nguyen Phong Nguyen Head of the ENS Crypto Team, Inria research professor (Directeur de recherche), Part-time professor at DI ENS PSL. My Interests Cryptography Cryptanalysis, post-quantum cryptography and real-world cryptography. Algorithmic Number Theory Lattices, integer factorization and algebraic number theory. Consulting Security analysis, reports, code review, education, etc. Research See my list of publications on DBLP, my IACR record and my HAL record. Latest publications A Complete Analysis of the BKZ Lattice Reduction Algorithm (Journal of Cryptology, 2024), with Jianwei Li On counterexamples to the Mertens conjecture (ANTS 2024, USA), with Seungki Kim Improved Provable Reduction of NTRU and Hypercubic Lattices (PQCRYPTO 2024, UK), with Henry Bambury Selected publications Slide Reduction, Revisited - Filling the Gaps in SVP Approximation (Crypto 2020) Random Sampling Revisited: Lattice Enumeration with Discrete Pruning (Eurocrypt 2017) Structural Lattice Reduction: Generalized Worst-Case to Average-Case Reductions and Homomorphic Cryptosystems (Eurocrypt 2016) Learning a Zonotope and More: Cryptanalysis of NTRUSign Countermeasures (Asiacrypt 2012) Lattice Enumeration Using Extreme Pruning (Eurocrypt 2010) Learning a Parallelepiped: Cryptanalysis of GGH and NTRU Signatures (Journal of Cryptology, 2009) An LLL Algorithm with Quadratic Complexity (SIAM Journal on Computing, 2009) Sieve algorithms for the shortest vector problem are practical ( Journal of Mathematical Cryptology, 2008) Distinctions ERC Advanced Grant (2020) PARQ: Lattices in a Parallel and Quantum World. Program co-chair of EUROCRYPT 2013 and 2014. Keynote speaker at EUROCRYPT 2011. Best Paper Award at EUROCRYPT 2006: joint work with Oded Regev. 2001 Cor Baayen Award. Teaching I am a part-time professor (professeur attachÃ©) at ENS PSL. Previously, I taught at Epita and University Paris 7. Current courses ENS/L3: Mathematical aspects of cryptography in 1st year course "Introduction to cryptography". MPRI/M2: Lattice-based cryptography in Course 2-12-1. MSSIS: Public-key cryptography. Se Service Management 2024-: Head of the ENS Crypto Team, also known as Inria Equipe Projet Cascade. 2015-19: French director of the Japanese-French Laboratory for Informatics, CNRS UMI 3527. 2013-15: European director of LIAMA, the Sino-European joint lab in Computer Science. 2008-12: Coordinator of MAYA, ECRYPT II's Virtual Lab on Asymmetric Cryptology, and member of the Management Committee of ECRYPT II. 2004-08: Coordinator of AZTEC, ECRYPT's Virtual Lab on Asymmetric Cryptology. Editorial Boards 2006-: Journal of Mathematical Cryptology 2006-2018: Journal of Cryptology Conference Program Committees CRYPTO: 2024, 2016, 2011, 2009 and 2006. EUROCRYPT: 2014, 2013, 2008, 2007 and 2005. ASIACRYPT: 2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2009, 2005, 2003 and 2002. Conference organization 2017: Program co-chair of ISC '17, 20th International Information Security Conference 2016: Coorganizer of the CIMPA-ICTP summer school on lattices and applications to cryptography and coding theory (Vietnam) 2014: Program co-chair of EUROCRYPT '14, 34th IACR Eurocrypt Conference. 2013: Program co-chair of EUROCRYPT '13 (Greece), 33th IACR Eurocrypt Conference. 2010: Chair of the Lattice Crypto Day (France) 2010: Program co-chair of PKC '10 (France), 13th IACR Conference on Practice and Theory in Public Key Cryptography 2007: Program Chair of LLL+25 (France) 2006: Program Chair of VietCrypt. 2005: Chair of the rump session of CRYPTO '05. 2005: ECRYPT Summer school on cryptanalysis. 2004: ECRYPT Workshop on Provable Security 2003: General co-chair of Financial Cryptography '03. Supervision PhD students 2022-: Henry Bambury 2010-13: Yuanmi Chen, now at Zhejiang Lab (China) 2009-13: Leo Ducas, now in CWI (Netherlands) 2005-08: Nicolas Gama, now in SandboxAQ (Switzerland) Interns Aurore Bernard (P7), Yuanmi Chen (ENS), Céline Chevalier (ENS-Cachan), Christophe Coupé (ENS-Lyon), Nicolas Gama (ENS), Benoit Larroque (ESIEA), Thai Hoang Le (Polytechnique), Gaetan Leurent (ENS), Hanyu Luo (Polytechnique), Bessem Hmidi (Polytechnique), Antoine Scemama (ENSICAEN), Yixin Shen (Polytechnique), Quentin Sopheap (Telecom Paris), Damien Stehlé (ENS), Thomas Vidick (ENS). Phong Nguyen I am an Inria research professor (Directeur de recherche) in DI ENS (Computer Science Department of ENS PSL, Paris, France), specialized in cryptography. I am the head of the ENS Crypto Team, also known as Inria Equipe Projet Cascade. I am also a part-time professor (professeur attachÃ©) at ENS PSL. I am the principal investigator of the ERC Advanced Grant PARQ: Lattices in a Parallel and Quantum World. My research sits at the intersection of cryptography, number theory and algorithms. I am a French citizen born in 1975 in Paris. I obtained my PhD in 1999 and my HDR in 2007. I graduated from ENS-Lyon and I passed the agrÃ©gation de mathÃ©matiques in 1997.
